script.name: plugin.mini.game.cipher
script.description: The cipher minigame script. Returns 1 on success, 0 on failure.
script.sourceplaintext:
* ************************************************ * SCRIPT NAME: plugin.mini.game.cipher * DESCRIPTION: Cipher mini-game. Part of the Hacking Mini-Game package * for the X3 AP Community Project. * Requires array of sector names (or other easy text) defined in setup script. * * AUTHOR: jack775544 DATE: January 2013 * ************************************************ * History: * Bullwinkle 2013-03-27 * - Changed ! to 0 for easier understanding (-X2-Illuminatus). * - Removed duplicate incoming message on failure (X2-Illuminatus). * - Reduced number of info lines in main and help menues (-X2-Illuminatus). * - Fixed bug in language file that caused menu heights to fill screen (Terre). * - Language file ID's 1602-1604 added. * - Language file ID's 1550-1551 changed. * - Language file ID's 1565-1570 changed. * * jack775544 29/01/2013 * - Uses info lines now for better presentation and a cleaner t file * - Opens as a custom info menu instead of a custom menu for a * nice widescreen design * - Adds a configurable menu height that can be defined in the t file * - Adds an author for the incoming message * * Bullwinkle 2013-01-14 * - Integrated with Mini Game shell. * - Performance tuning. * - Dynamic color-coding of menu for easier navigation. * - Minor ease-of-use and esthetic enhancements (script and t file). * * jack775544 8/01/2013 * - Changed to forward cipher * - Uses new menu based interface * * jack775544 2/01/2013 * - Initial Release * * Made by jack775544 for the X3 AP Community Project * - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
$PageID = get global variable: name='mini.game.PageID'
* Constants $c.cipher.max.variation = read text: page=$PageID id=1601 $c.cipher.max.variation = string $c.cipher.max.variation to integer $c.text.subtitle.start.game = read text: page=$PageID id=56 $c.sound.check.click = 1119 $c.page7.min = read text: page=$PageID id=57 $c.page7.min = string $c.page7.min to integer $c.page7.max = read text: page=$PageID id=58 $c.page7.max = string $c.page7.max to integer $c.color.none = read text: page=$PageID id=33 $c.color.cyan = read text: page=$PageID id=34 $c.color.red = read text: page=$PageID id=35 $c.color.yellow = read text: page=$PageID id=36 $c.color.green = read text: page=$PageID id=37 $c.color.white = read text: page=$PageID id=38 $c.color.blue = read text: page=$PageID id=39 $c.color.magenta = read text: page=$PageID id=32 $c.color.orange = read text: page=$PageID id=31 $c.main.menu.height = read text: page=$PageID id=1603 $c.main.menu.height = string $c.main.menu.height to integer $c.help.menu.height = read text: page=$PageID id=1604 $c.help.menu.height = string $c.help.menu.height to integer $c.name.boardcomputer = read text: page=$PageID id=1602
* Setup $Pos = [FALSE] $Result = [FALSE]
* Get a word for enciphering * BW: =============================== * $Texts = get global variable: name='mini.game.texts' $Texts = get global variable: name='mini.game.sector.names' * BW: ===============================
$Size = size of array $Texts $Rnd = random value from 0 to $Size - 1 $Password = $Texts[$Rnd]
@ $PasswordLC = null -> call script plugin.mini.game.lower.case : String will be converted to Lower Case=$Password
* Gets the alphabet $Alphabet = read text: page id=$PageID, from 1500 to 1549 to array, include empty=[FALSE] $Alphabetlength = size of array $Alphabet
* Fixes bug where z would be a inc $Alphabetlength =
* Makes a number for enciphering $lengthP = get length of string $PasswordLC $Pass = '' $CipherStr = '' $Count = 0 while $Count < $lengthP $CharP = get substring of $PasswordLC offset=$Count length=1
* BW: =============================== * This loop is very slow; mostly due to calling an external script and passing an array to it. * Changing the call to a sub does not help much, so just put the code in-line here. * $Pos = null-> call script 'plugin.mini.game.posinarray' : Value=$CharP Array=$Alphabet $Pos = [FALSE] $pia.Size = size of array $Alphabet $pia.Count = 0 while $pia.Count < $pia.Size $ValArr = $Alphabet[$pia.Count] if $CharP == $ValArr $Pos = $pia.Count end $pia.Count = $pia.Count + 1 end * BW: ===============================
if is datatype[ $Pos ] == DATATYPE_INT
* BW: =============================== * Allow easier ciphers by reducing the maximum variation in each bit of the cipher key. $Cipher = random value from 0 to $c.cipher.max.variation - 1 * BW: ===============================
$CipherStrTemp = convert number $Cipher to string inc $Pos = $New = $Pos + $Cipher * In case the value is over the number of letters in the alphabet $New = $New mod $Alphabetlength * Do this, for use in arrays. Remember programmers count from 0, people from 1! dec $New = if $New == -1 $New = 0 end $PassC = $Alphabet[$New] $Pass = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $Pass, $PassC, null, null, null $CipherStr = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $CipherStr, $CipherStrTemp, null, null, null
else if $CharP == ' ' $CipherStr = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $CipherStr, ' ', null, null, null $Pass = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $Pass, ' ', null, null, null
else * BW: -2013-03-27: $CipherStr = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $CipherStr, '!', null, null, null $CipherStr = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $CipherStr, '0', null, null, null $Pass = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $Pass, $CharP, null, null, null
* BW: Umlaut support $Special = read text: page=$PageID id=4000 $SChar = find position of pattern $CharP in $Special if $SChar != -1 inc $Count = end
end inc $Count = @ = wait 1 ms end
* Pass is the encrypted password (the answer) * CipherStr is the cipher that needs to be used * Password is the string to encrypt (PasswordLC is that in lower case)
$RetVal = '' OpenMain: if is datatype[ $RetValNew ] == DATATYPE_STRING $RetVal = $RetValNew end $Menu = create custom menu array set menu option: $Menu, maximum menu height=$c.main.menu.height lines $line1a = read text: page=$PageID id=1550 $line1b = read text: page=$PageID id=1551 $line1c = read text: page=$PageID id=1552
* BW: =============================== * Color-code and put strings on single line. $line2 = read text: page=$PageID id=1554 $PasswordDisp = sprintf: pageid=$PageID textid=1593, $Password, null, null, null, null $line2 = $line2 + $PasswordDisp
$line3 = read text: page=$PageID id=1555 $CipherDisp = sprintf: pageid=$PageID textid=1593, $CipherStr, null, null, null, null $line3 = $line3 + $CipherDisp * BW: ===============================
* BW: =============================== * Dynamic Color-coded menu for easier navigation. if $RetVal == '' * Green Enter Solution $line4 = read text: page=$PageID id=1556 $line4 = $c.color.green + $line4 + $c.color.none
* Gray Submit $line6 = read text: page=$PageID id=1559 else * Orange Enter Solution $line4 = read text: page=$PageID id=1556 $line4 = $c.color.orange + $line4 + $c.color.none
* Green Submit $line6 = read text: page=$PageID id=1559 $line6 = $c.color.green + $line6 + $c.color.none end * BW: ===============================
$linehelp = read text: page=$PageID id=1557
* BW: =============================== * Color code and single line. $line5 = read text: page=$PageID id=1558 $RetValDisp = sprintf: pageid=$PageID textid=1590, $RetVal, null, null, null, null $line5 = $line5 + $c.color.cyan + $RetValDisp + $c.color.none * BW: ===============================
$TitleMain = read text: page=$PageID id=1580 $DescMain = read text: page=$PageID id=1581 * Description add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1a * BW: -2013-03-27: add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1b * BW: -2013-03-27: add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1c * The Password is: add non selectable menu item: $Menu, text=$line2
* The cipher is: add non selectable menu item: $Menu, text=$line3
* Enter Solution add custom menu item to array $Menu: text=$line4 returnvalue='enter' add non selectable menu item: $Menu, text='____________________________' * Your answer: add non selectable menu item: $Menu, text=$line5
* Submit Answer add custom menu item to array $Menu: text=$line6 returnvalue='finish' add non selectable menu item: $Menu, text='____________________________' * Help add custom menu item to array $Menu: text=$linehelp returnvalue='help'
* Show Menu set menu option: $Menu, maximum menu height=15 lines @ $MenuRet = open custom menu: title=$TitleMain description=$DescMain option array=$Menu
if $MenuRet == 'enter' gosub EnterVal goto label OpenMain
* BW: =============================== * Add case to handle player cancel (Esc). else if $MenuRet == -1 * Player Canceled $Result = -1 return $Result * BW: ===============================
else if $MenuRet == 'help' gosub Help goto label OpenMain end
* Convert to lower case @ $RetValLC = null -> call script plugin.mini.game.lower.case : String will be converted to Lower Case=$RetVal
* Displays whether success or failure if $RetValLC == $Pass * Success * $msg = read text: page=$PageID id=1591 $msg = sprintf: pageid=$PageID textid=1591, $c.name.boardcomputer, null, null, null, null send incoming message $msg to player: type:[Log.Alert], display it=[TRUE], log it=null * BW: =============================== * 1 and True are not exactly the same. We use 3-state logic when appropriate. $Result = 1 * BW: =============================== else * Fail $msg = sprintf: pageid=$PageID textid=1592, $c.name.boardcomputer, null, null, null, null * BW: 2013-03-27: send incoming message $msg to player: display it=[TRUE]
* BW: =============================== $Result = 0 * BW: =============================== end
return $Result
* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- EnterVal: $Desc = sprintf: fmt='%s - %s', $Password, $CipherStr, null, null, null $RetValNew = null -> get user input: type=String, title=$Desc endsub * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Help: $HelpMenu = create custom menu array set menu option: $HelpMenu, maximum menu height=$c.help.menu.height lines set menu option: $HelpMenu, maximum infolines=30 $HelplTitle = read text: page=$PageID id=1582 $HelplDesc = read text: page=$PageID id=1583 $XStudio.Hidden = read text: page=$PageID id=1560 add custom menu info line to array $HelpMenu: text=$XStudio.Hidden add custom menu info line to array $HelpMenu: text='____________________________' * for $Count = 1565 to 1570 step 1 * add custom menu info line to array $HelpMenu: page=$PageID id=$Count * end $XStudio.Hidden = read text: page=$PageID id=1565 add custom menu info line to array $HelpMenu: text=$XStudio.Hidden $XStudio.Hidden = read text: page=$PageID id=1574 add custom menu item to array $HelpMenu: text=$XStudio.Hidden returnvalue=-1 set menu option: $HelpMenu, maximum menu height=16 lines @ $Nothing = open custom menu: title=$HelplTitle description=$HelplDesc option array=$HelpMenu endsub * ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
return null

comment.var: DESCRIPTION: Cipher mini-game. Part of the Hacking Mini-Game package
for the X3 AP Community Project.
Requires array of sector names (or other easy text) defined in setup script.
- Removed duplicate incoming message on failure (X2-Illuminatus).
- Reduced number of info lines in main and help menues (-X2-Illuminatus).
- Fixed bug in language file that caused menu heights to fill screen (Terre).
- Uses info lines now for better presentation and a cleaner t file
- Opens as a custom info menu instead of a custom menu for a
- Adds a configurable menu height that can be defined in the t file
- Adds an author for the incoming message
- Dynamic color-coding of menu for easier navigation.
- Minor ease-of-use and esthetic enhancements (script and t file).
Made by jack775544 for the X3 AP Community Project

line.text: String will be converted to Lower Case=

comment.var: Fixes bug where z would be a
This loop is very slow; mostly due to calling an external script and passing an array to it.
Changing the call to a sub does not help much, so just put the code in-line here.
Allow easier ciphers by reducing the maximum variation in each bit of the cipher key.
In case the value is over the number of letters in the alphabet
Do this, for use in arrays. Remember programmers count from 0, people from 1!
BW: -2013-03-27: $CipherStr = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $CipherStr, '!', null, null, null
Pass is the encrypted password (the answer)
CipherStr is the cipher that needs to be used
Password is the string to encrypt (PasswordLC is that in lower case)
Color-code and put strings on single line.
Dynamic Color-coded menu for easier navigation.

line.text: add custom menu info line to array

comment.var: BW: -2013-03-27: add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1b
BW: -2013-03-27: add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1c

line.text: add custom menu item to array
add custom menu item to array
add custom menu item to array

comment.var: Add case to handle player cancel (Esc).

line.text: String will be converted to Lower Case=

comment.var: 1 and True are not exactly the same. We use 3-state logic when appropriate.
BW: 2013-03-27: send incoming message $msg to player: display it=[TRUE]

line.text: add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu info line to array

comment.var: add custom menu info line to array $HelpMenu: page=$PageID id=$Count

line.text: add custom menu info line to array
add custom menu item to array

sval.val: The cipher minigame script. Returns 1 on success, 0 on failure.
DESCRIPTION: Cipher mini-game. Part of the Hacking Mini-Game package
for the X3 AP Community Project.
Requires array of sector names (or other easy text) defined in setup script.
- Removed duplicate incoming message on failure (X2-Illuminatus).
- Reduced number of info lines in main and help menues (-X2-Illuminatus).
- Fixed bug in language file that caused menu heights to fill screen (Terre).
- Uses info lines now for better presentation and a cleaner t file
- Opens as a custom info menu instead of a custom menu for a
- Adds a configurable menu height that can be defined in the t file
- Adds an author for the incoming message
- Dynamic color-coding of menu for easier navigation.
- Minor ease-of-use and esthetic enhancements (script and t file).
Made by jack775544 for the X3 AP Community Project
Fixes bug where z would be a
This loop is very slow; mostly due to calling an external script and passing an array to it.
Changing the call to a sub does not help much, so just put the code in-line here.
Allow easier ciphers by reducing the maximum variation in each bit of the cipher key.
In case the value is over the number of letters in the alphabet
Do this, for use in arrays. Remember programmers count from 0, people from 1!
BW: -2013-03-27: $CipherStr = sprintf: fmt='%s%s', $CipherStr, '!', null, null, null
Pass is the encrypted password (the answer)
CipherStr is the cipher that needs to be used
Password is the string to encrypt (PasswordLC is that in lower case)
Color-code and put strings on single line.
Dynamic Color-coded menu for easier navigation.
BW: -2013-03-27: add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1b
BW: -2013-03-27: add custom menu info line to array $Menu: text=$line1c
Add case to handle player cancel (Esc).
1 and True are not exactly the same. We use 3-state logic when appropriate.
BW: 2013-03-27: send incoming message $msg to player: display it=[TRUE]
add custom menu info line to array $HelpMenu: page=$PageID id=$Count
